alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Randolph; Southeast Randolph; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 2:56PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Randolph and southeastern Upshur Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 256 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Mill Creek, or 20 miles south of Buckhannon, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mill Creek, Dailey, and Huttonsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northeastern West Virginia.
